newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Surgical Q3 U.S. sales up 17 pct.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Surgical Q3 U.S. sales up 17 pct.

text.p: U.S. Surgical Corp said its domestic third quarter sales rose 17 percent over the year ago period, while international sales rose three percent.
Excluding the impact of the strong U.S. dollar, the surgical products company's international sales would have risen nine percent, it said.
The company reported net sales for the quarter of $280 million, up from $255 million a year ago. Its earnings per share of $0.39 topped the year-ago figure of $0.37 and First Call consensus of $0.35.
Its gross margins were 59 percent of sales, up from 58 percent a year ago, while selling, general and administrative expenses were 39 percent, a four-percentage-point drop from 1995's third quarter.
